title: MS AccessIsDate()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessIsDate()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Check whether the expression can be converted to a date:
SELECT 
  IsDate(Now());

Definition and Usage
The IsDate() function checks whether an expression can be converted to a 
date.
This function returns a Boolean value. TRUE (-1) indicates that the expression is a valid date, 
and FALSE (0) indicates that the expression is not a valid date.
Syntax
IsDate(
expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required. The value to test
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Return TRUE if the expression is a valid date, otherwise FALSE:
SELECT
  IsDate("Hello");

Example
Return TRUE if the expression is a valid date, otherwise FALSE:
SELECT
  IsDate("August 25, 2017");

Example
Return TRUE if the expression is a valid date, otherwise FALSE:
SELECT IsDate(#25/8/2017#);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessIsDate()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessIsDate()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessIsDate()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
